dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: X-CLOSE. A SCALPEL returned to its place in a neat array of TAXIDERMY TOOLS. Long surgical TWEEZERS taken. A stead HAND grasps a CLAY BIRD FORM. Then sets the second eye. Unhurried. Meticulous. A MYSTERY MAN, features obscured, sets the tweezers aside reaches for a black lump on the table, revealed to be shi feathers as he wraps it around the form. Adjusts it so th glass eyes peer out through holes in the skin of this lar CROW. A taxidermy specimen. WIDE, the man works across the room under the pooled ligh of a draftsman's lamp, the Crow on the table in front of him. His identity yet to discover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: X-WIDE. "THE WALLS" like a medieval castle above a throng of PROTESTERS and GAWKERS. A POSTCARD at first, then sign of movement--handheld placards and flickering candles telegraph an imminent execution. The group shifts amoeba like as... A LARGE MERCEDES approaches, slowly works its way into the edge of the cro INSIDE THE BENZ NATHAN RANDALL, father of the victim comforts ERIN RANDALL, seventeen year old sister, as she looks up in terror at the bodies pressed against the car, the throng between the car and the prison entrance. The car stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are there so many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold on to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD--a Protestor's poster visible. "Remember the Victim." With a picture of LAUREN RANDALL, the deceased, who bears a striking resemblance to survivi sister Erin. And another sign--"Happy Birthday Alex."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's because they're doing this on his birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a deep breath, they get out of the car and... WITH THE RANDALLS as they make their way through the thro toward a special entrance marked "WITNESSES," nearly with reach when WHOMP. Erin shields her face as a BRIGHT LIGHT comes on. OVER TV REPORTER BARBARA GONZALEZ Action Newsteam addressing the Nathans. Speaking into a mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Randall. Sir. Do you think this execution will bring you a sense of closure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan pushes past Gonzalez, taking Erin's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin. Your sister...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave us alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Reporter TURNS to the camera, not missing a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A difficult time for everyone involved. (then) Interesting fact. It will take about twenty-one cents of electricity to execute Alex Corvis tonight on this, his twenty-first birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a BIRTHDAY CAKE, twenty one candles flickering a it makes its way past deathrow cells, held waiter style o one hand by MERCER, a MUSTACHED prison GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLANG. The barred door opens and the cake swoops in, land on a small table next to a CHESS GAME in progress and an untouched last meal. ADJUST to find... ALEX CORVIS. Twenty-One today. Disarmingly appealing. Peaceful. Simple clothes. He looks up from the game, at.. PETER WALSH, Alex's pro-bono attorney and only friend, trying not to explode at this shit-eating stunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't order that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found the man with the scar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite himself, Alex looks up. Mercer gestures at... THE CAKE in the middle of the candles, an arm made of frostin with a large ZIGZAG marking on the forearm, also frosting FAVORING ALEX looking from the cake up to Mercer, who nod at the candles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Make a wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intense whisper) Get it out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex focusses on the chess board. Tries to anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH. The harsh Newsteam video light WHUMPS on, illuminating a WRINKLED OLD WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I've come to a lot of these over the years, but this one has many unique aspects. Youth of the condemned. That's unusual. Fifty three stab wounds. Kind of a record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Corvis still maintaining his innocence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, they all say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH. A nervous, not to say shifty looking THOMAS "TOMMY LEONARD, thirty five year old key witness in the trial, talks to Gonzalez under the hot video light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't fault him saying I lied on the stand. Facing the chair, you do what you gotta do. But I saw those two fighting that night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy shifts uncomfortably, silent as we HOLD a long beat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE. A Chess piece, a CASTLE, shoved at CAMERA. ADJUST to INCLUDE ALEX. He breathes deliberately, trying to hold it together. His hand shakes as he removes it from the piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex gets up, crosses to a small ledge on the other side of the cell that holds a few books and pictures. He finds A PICTURE OF LAUREN AND ALEX In a grove of tall trees. A self-portrait by autotimer. Arms around each other. Her head on his shoulder. Happy. RESUME Alex staring at the photo, taped to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's been holding me together is the hope that maybe you do go someplace. And I'll be seeing her again soon. Only what will I say? That I was too stupid to find the guy who killed her? That he's down here laughing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her... we'll get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someday he'll surface and I'll get him for both of you. I promise. I'll find the guy with the scar.

dialogues.speaker: EXT GARRISON PRISON
dialogues.text: FLASH. Four UNIFORMED COPS--DUTTON, ERLICH, LARKIN and TOOMEY--in the harsh news light. Erlich holds a CANE in one hand. Larkin and Toomey are twosie monkeys, smoking cigarettes with eerie simultaneit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This mystery man with the scar... (indicates forearm) ...the zigzag, whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erlich gives a long-suffering look. Like it's preposterou But he's too gentlemanly to say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We couldn't find him. And, obviously, the jury didn't buy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people here seem to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People here are protesting the execution of a kid just turning twenty-one. A kid who had a tough life. No parents, no dough. Always had to fight for everything. It's a tragedy, it really is. But I don't see a single sign telling me Alex Corvis is innocent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look around. He's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex still gazing at the picture of Lauren. At the board, Walsh moves a piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was facing the hot seat, I'd want my attorney banging down the door of the Supreme Court, not playing board games. But maybe that's just me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look up as Mercer appears outside the barred door to the cell, starts to unlock it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It really is. Other prison personnel arrive outside the cell in various uniforms: A MINISTER with clerical collar, the WARDEN, two GUARDS. Waiting. Walsh crosses, very emotional how. Gives Alex a huge hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to watch. I don't want to give them the pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two friends exchange a long last look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. C'mon now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Alex exits past Mercer, Walsh sits down on the cot. He's hard to read a second until he lashes out, flips... THE CAKE against the wall where it hits, slides down, sti semi-intact as it hits the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead Man Walking. A mini parade past the cells of the condemned. One guard flanks Alex, another follows. The Warden and Minister out in front. HANDS extend from the other cells as Alex passes. Unable to touch, but he reaches for them, a gesture of solidarit Mercer catches up with the group, flanking Alex cell-side Alex drops his hand, cut off even from that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parade continues down another hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHAIR, an atavism, sits alone a moment before the entourage enters and begins a surprisingly well choreographed last dance. The Warden gestures, and Alex is escorted to his place in the chair. The Guards move in, death attendants now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lord is my shepherd, I shall not want...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MINISTER CONTINUES as... CLOSE. Handstraps tightened. WHOP. WHOP. Alex squirms despite his resolve. Through an act of will, calms himsel Looks up at... THE PHONE. On the wall. A last possibility of reprise. CLOSE. Trouser legs slit. Footstraps tightened around bar ankles. Electrodes checked. CLOSE. Chest strap tightened. Yanked again for good measu ALEX gasps. It's hard to breathe now with the strap tight across his chest. CLOSE. Copper mesh. Pieces of sponge jerry-sewn onto it, the irregular stitching giving it an unsettling natural appearance. ADJUST to REVEAL this is the electrode in the odd leather HELMET tightened now on Alex's head. THE EXECUTIONER. Pulls a hood over his own obscured face. Moves behind a half curtain at the side of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concluding) ... and I will dwell in the house of the Lord. Forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAP. The Minister shuts his bible. WIDER. Some weird sin Alex strapped into the chair, unable to move. The guards exit, jobs done. The Warden nots and...

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH PLEXI
dialogues.text: as the CURTAINS OPEN. Two dozen observers crammed into a space the width of a singlewide trailer. Erin. Her father. The Cops. Tommy Leonard. Gonzalez and other media types. Prison personnel Every seat occupied. Sweaty and surreal. All looking at him. IN THE DEATH CHAMBER The Warden steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander Frederick Corvis. Do you have any last words?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thick silence. Alex looks unprepared, uneasy as he scan a sea of hostile faces, settling on Erin and her dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loved Lauren. I still do. I'm innocent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin shakes her head, disgusted. Looks away. ALEX'S POV - THE LAST SECONDS OF HIS LIFE SLOWING in his inner perception, movement ramping down as Alex scans the disbelieving faces. The Phone. Silent. No reprise. The Observation Room witne door opens. A Guard in the back row deferentially offers his seat to the NEW ARRIVAL, a man in dark clothes, his face obscured by REFLECTIONS in the plexiglass. As he UNBUTTONS his shirt cuff... The warden steps to the side of the room, nods to the executioner who lifts a COVER off a large switch. The New Arrival pulls his shirtsleeve back over his forea exposing a scar for Alex, THE SCAR, an odd zigzag pattern of raised welts, a pattern deliberately formed of skin. The Executioner throws the switch. ON ALEX SHAKING violen as he fights to stay alive, time extremely subjective now as he chokes out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indistinct, filtered) Murderer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The word bubbles up as if from underwater, audible only t Alex. Alex wrenches his head, a superhuman act of will trying to ID the Scar Man through the reflections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE HELMET starts to smoke. Then a burst of FLAME at Alex head. A BOTCHED EXECUTION made worse by Alex's struggle to see, to stay alive. IN THE OBSERVATION ROOM The observers panic, horrified. Only the Scar Man calm as he covers his arm, rebuttons hi shirt. Face always obscured. IN THE DEATH CHAMBER Alex in electro-spasm, smoke filling the room, the warden in real time now as he runs to pull the curtain closed. It JAMS partway across. ALEX expires in the char, grotesquely burned, EYES OPEN as the Warden finally yanks the curtain closed. IN THE OBSERVATION ROOM The Scar Man slips out, but the rest remain, transfixed, horrified. Erin and others in tears. HOLD a long beat, their GASPS faintly audible. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cruel, who's to say, but it sure was unusual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two guards push a gurney down a reverberant hallway far from the in-your-face security of deathrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this. Goddamn helmet melted down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, my friend, is a deterrent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They WIPE past, Alex's charred remains visible a moment, parts of the helmet fused on his face and head, his body convulsed in a pugilistic attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards swing the gurney to a stop by a steel locker, one of several. Mercer opens the locker door. The unceremoniously slide the body into the locker and... BANG. The body hits the open door. Convulsed as it is, th body won't really fit through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRUNCH. The sound of something breaking as the SHOVE Alex into the cubby hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do they even autopsy these guys? Cause of death is pretty fucking obvious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM INSIDE THE LOCKER. The door slams shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on the PICTURE of Alex and Lauren. ADJUST to include Walsh, looking at it. Pained. Still try to understand. He secures it to the lid of the case alrea containing the neatly packed chess set. Closes it. Bows his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The protestors are gone, as is the Newsteam, but the four Cops are still there, Larkin and Toomey synchro-smoking. They look up as the Randalls emerge shaken from the Witne entrance. FAVORING NATHAN RANDALL He speaks softly to Erin, who's leaning against him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Erin) I'll meet you atthe car, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues on and Randall crosses to the cops, who wai patiently to see what he'll say. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all wish this had ended better. Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randall nods. Like that's all anyone could say. As he wal off the Cops fall into easy chatter. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE. A face slides into frame in PROFILE, too tight to be recognizable. Just an eye, peering... EYE'S POV - THROUGH A MAGNIFYING GLASS A coarse ZIGZAG stitch shaped like the Scar runs the length of the Crow's underbelly. The end stitch now tied with a tiny knot. Tightened just so. THE MYSTERY MAN features obscured stil grabs a bent surgical SCISSORS, snips the excess thread. Smoothes black feathers into place, hiding the stitching on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CROW Finished. The Man gets up, leaves. CAMERA PUSHING on the Bird's head as we HEAR a door shut, still PUSHING on the glass eye that BLINKS now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE THE LOCKER. A human EYE BLINKS. Barely visible in the darkness. Alex KICKS with a YELL and... IN THE MORGUE.  The locker door flies open and Alex spill onto the floor. Gropes a few seconds on hands and knees before a SHADOW passes over him evoking a primitive response. He cowers, looks up at... A LARGE CROW flutters through the bars of a high window, lands near him on the floor. It looks at him, then flaps its way up to the autopsy countertop, cocks its head. Fol me. ALEX strains to pull himself up on the gurney that brough him here. HIS POV as he slowly rises above the gurney--the Crow in front of a mirror over the splash sink. It flies off, revealing Alex's reflection. Charred. Hideous. ALEX drops back to the floor with a SCREAM. Turns, sees himself in a stainless door and SMASHES it with his fist. THE BASHED STAINLESS DOOR the word "MORGUE," painted on the wall behind Alex, brought into focus at the center of the concavity. ALEX thrashes, trying to avoid his reflection, but the dim mirrors have him surrounded. THE CROW flaps down, crazed too, as if in empathy. CAWING loudly, finally getting Alex's attention. ALEX settles, hazards another look at his reflection in stainless steel His body looks less misshapen now. He looks at his arms, hands, no longer burned. Pulls himself up on the gurney again, cautiously. OVER ALEX as he slowly rises above the gurney a second time, looks in the mirror. His body miraculously HEALED, covered by shredded clothing. His face obscured by the meltdown helmet. He slowly approaches the mirror on unsteady feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his own reflection) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex starts to tear away the helmet and gets a first frightening FLASH as his fingers touch it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX'S INTERNAL POV - FLASHBACK A blitz return to his own execution. The copper screen, the helmet lowered into pla Electro-spasm. The faintest glimpse of a jagged scar seen darkly. RESUME -ALEX clutching the helmet on his head, ripping it off in one painful OVERCRANKED movement and... OVER ALEX, IN THE MIRROR It's Alex, and yet not. His face marked with the Crow MASK, jagged WARPAINT where the melt helmet ran down his face. An indelible reminder of the botched execution. he stares at himself for a couple of deep breaths. Then WHAM! Shatters the mirror with a marti punch. THE FRACTURED MIRROR Alex's mask reflected in shards as his busy hands remove certain pieces of broken glass. His purpose unclear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Crow hops out into the hallway, flies toward us, land with a CAW as Alex enters the hallway, framed against hig walls. His tentative movements growing more assured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow the leader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Crow flies off and Alex follows, to... A DOOR marked "No Unauthorized Entry." As they pass through...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a MONITOR, a SCHEMATIC MAP of the prison. A smal red light FLASHES. The GUARD keys a communications radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got unauthorized movement in "B five."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WITH the LEGS of a Guard walking quickly. REVEAL Mercer. His RADIO crackling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Mercer. I'm on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He passes through the "No Unauthorized Entry" door into..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty. Bars at the far end spell seriously secure territo Mercer moves cautiously up the empty hallway, stops as... The Crow hops out from a side hallway. Drawing him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Found our intruder. It's got a beak and a death wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercer pulls out his NIGHTSTICK, loses the bird as it hop back THROUGH BARS into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex looks around his now empty cell. On the wall is a rectangle, clearer than the wall around it, where the photograph of Alex and Lauren had been before Walsh remov it. Alex goes up to thewall and touches the spot. FLASH! ALEX'S INTERNAL POV FLASH of LAUREN, laughing as she beckons to someone, Alex, who joins her in frame as w hear the whir of the camera auto-timer. A click, as the picture is taken. Alex and Lauren are frozen in the pose of Alex's photograph. RESUME The picture is gone. Alex, perplexed, stands looki at the blank spot on the wall for a moment. He turns and exits the cell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercer is peering through the double-barred gate at the end of the row as Alex emerges from his former cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still into radio) Get me some backup. We got one loose on the row. (through the bars to Alex) Now who the fuck are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex looks up, sees Mercer and FLASH... ALEX'S INTERNAL POV A pop of Mercer bringing the birthday cake. A wash of flame, twenty one candles. A blip of Wals Of a White King. RESUME Alex perplexed, looking at the cake still litterin the floor of his ex-cell, candles melted down. Mercer wor his way through the double-barred doors onto the row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what have you done to your face there beauty queen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The INMATE occupying the cell next to Alex's peers out through the bars, vanishes again as Mercer WHOPS the bars once with his nightstick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well... here's a present for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOSH. Mercer swings his NIGHTSTICK at Alex's head. Alex catches it, instinctively in one hand. Mercer reaches for A RED PANIC BUTTON hanging off his guard belt. Mercer sla it. FAVORING ALEX lets go of the stick, looks at his own hand, surprised. WHAM!  Mercer broadsides Alex's head with the stick. Alex goes down shocked, not from pain, from the fact that some would attack him. WHAM WHAM WHAM. Mercer brutalizes Alex, collapsed at his feet as... TWO GUARDS enter the far end of the Row, race toward Alex's cell, one holding a TASER. Its LASER SIGHT finds Alex, crumpled in front of Mercer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ok. Man. Had me going there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like it's over. The guards relax. ALEX suddenly loo up at Mercer. Zero damage from the blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Make a wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taser!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex wheels around as Guard One squeezes the trigger. CROWVISION The Taser Darts speed toward Camera. RESUME Alex shunts himself to the side and the TASER DART impale themselves in Mercer's thighs. He drops fibrillati A CHEER goes up from the men in their cells, who become progressively rowdier as the guards BOLT and Alex follows strength in his stride, nightstick in hand. Pieces of FLAMING TOILETPAPER flung now from the cells of Deathrow. AT THE FAR ENTRANCE the two Guards scramble to get the door closed behind them before Alex catches up. They'd make it except Alex hurls... THE NIGHTSTICK flying end over end like a throwing knife, catching the trailing guard in the back of the head, dropping him in the door, propping it open. ALEX enters the cage entrance to Deathrow, sharing the space with the Guard still standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pats pockets, then) Keys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The frightened Guard opens the door into the next hallway and bolts. Leaving the keys. The Crow hopping, screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a SCHEMATIC MAP of the prison. Lit up like a Christmas tree now with flashing red lights. The Guard keys a communications radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unauthorized movement in B five, B six, C three, four, five...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another LIGHT goes on. They're starting to make a line. Buzzers going off now. A general ALARM sounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escape in progress. Heading for the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Crow flaps up the stairwell. Alex on its heels, takin steps three at a time. AT THE TOP OF THE STAIRWELL The Crow waits on a LANDING with a door marked "Emergency Use Only." Plus a dozen lin of assorted instructions. Guards' feet THUNDER below, approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear the pitter patter of little feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the door. The ALARM is LOUD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark a moment. Then a HUGE SPOTLIGHT hits Alex, casting long shadows. He looks up at a GUARD TOWER, the source of the light. And of a BULLHORN VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not proceed. Back slowly away from the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if in defiance, the Crow hops toward the fence, old chain link topped with razorwire along the perimeter of the roof. BULLHORN VOICE CONTINUES as Alex follows... ALEX'S POV through the fence, down fifty feet to the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex turns, sees... A HALF DOZEN GUARDS emerge from the stairwell to the top of the roof, level weapons at Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE FENCE - ALEX climbs quickly to the top, where he grabs two painful handfuls of razorwire that cut deeply into this hand. He extricates himself, balancing atop the fence. And looks... ALEX'S HANDS The jagged bloodlines disappear, miraculousl heal. FAVORING ALEX as he holds up his hands to show the guards a kid-like smile on his face. They respond by raising their weapons and BAM BAM BAM. Alex hurls himself off the edge in a hail of Gunfire that Dopplers down to silence as he falls, falls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT THE BASE OF "THE WALLS" Alex hits, flushing PIGEONS, that fill frame with manic wings. As the SPOTLIGHT sweeps toward Alex he rolls off, over th sidewalk, between two parked cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE ROOFTOP Mercer and the others stand there dumbstru looking down as the SPOTLIGHT finds nothing. A RADIO CRACKLES. Mercer keys it a beat later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Physical head count shows all inmates present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercer moves the radio away from his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who was the fucking Houdini?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT THE BASE OF "THE WALLS" Illuminated by spill from the Spotlight, Alex crouches between two cars. He leans forwa checking his reflection in a CHROME HUBCAP. A huge smile spreads over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs. Life--or whatever this is--is good. So far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CROW flies past tall buildings downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crow flies past letters P-O-L-I-C-E on the side of an older building taking us to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMASH. A hand punches through a sash window, right throug the imbedded security wires, roughly rips off the latch inside. Retracts, bleeding. The window opens. It's Alex, on the fire escape, checking out his arm as th BLEEDING STOPS. Alex follows the Crow into the dark room packed with file cabinets and evidence bins, wire lockers. And a desk, str with POLICE FORMS. Plus a vertical SPIKE with processed evidence request FORMS impaled on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking out desk) Police? Evidence? (then, to Crow) Look. I like what we've got going here. But I can think of lots better to do with it than fighting crime. Know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Crow makes its way to a file cabinet, the top drawer marked "Cl-Cr."  Alex lingers a moment at the desk, eye o the spike. WHOP. Alex drives his hand onto the SPIKE. Looks up, delighted. CAW. The Crow gives Alex an admonishing look. Alex pulls the spike from his hand. Instant healing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, ok... what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex opens the top drawer. Looking for... he's not sure what. Glibly goes through folders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing under "Crow."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops. Pulls out the first FILE out in a thick section marked "CORVIS, ALEXANDER F." Having caught a glimpse of. IN THE FILE - ALEX'S MUG SHOT And rap sheet. X-CLOSE. We see "Murder 1st degree," "Penalty Phase: Find for Execution."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Execution?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But even this has little interest for him as the finds th words "Lauren Randall" on the page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (remembering) Lauren...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX rips the drawer out of the file cabinet, dumps it CRASHING on the ground. He drops to the floor with a grow sense of dread, feeling with both hands, finding... A SPLAY OF PHTOGRAPHS encased in plastic -- the prosecutions' background presentation on Alex and Lauren. The first photo shows LAUREN Posing jauntily, her arm aro a Snowman. She and the Snowman wear matching Boston Red Sox caps. ALEX'S INTERNAL POV On Alex, anticipating...WHAP!  A snowball nails him square in the face. WIDE to reveal LAUREN running for cover as Young Alex sco up snow for ammo. He lobs a snowball at Lauren, just as she slips to the ground. she doesn't get up right away. Alex is just a shade concernec as he runs over to her. He reaches the spot to find LAUREN in the snow, waving her arms and legs to make a snow angel. She looks up at him and beckons him to lie on top of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, an Angel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm your Angel. Come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RESUME Alex's pained smile at the memory, until he finds: THE MURDER WEAPON A rough looking hunting knife bagged an tagged as "AC-005: Murder Weapon." ALEX frantic now, spreading out the file contents, finding... CRIME SCENE PHOTOS In a Grove of tall trees, Lauren Randall's stabbed and mutilated body, her neck slashed, head lolling sideways, melds with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX'S INTERNAL POV Brief glimpses of Lauren with Alex in the Grove, happy, like the still photo Alex kept in his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RESUME Alex full-blown tortured now, throwing things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I didn't...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex SMASHES his own head against the metal file cabinets wounding himself on the handles, droplets of blood flying now, spattering the evidence on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for the KNIFE, the murder weapon, to end the pain and FLASH...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX'S INTERNAL POV A tunnelvision pop of Tommy Leonard o the witness stand. The knife held up for him by an unseen lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His knife. Corvis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RESUME Alex shakes his head "no." Incredulous, horrified. The fury abating with a growing sense of mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lie, you lie, you lie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex fishing through the detritus around him, finding... "THE LIST" A list of witnesses by category with contact numbers, addresses. Alex's finger finds Eyewitness Thomas Leonard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas Leonard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DOOR TO THE EVIDENCE ROOM opens. A YOUNG COP enters, walks slowly past rows of file cabine looking down empty aisles until finding the file drawerfu Alex dumped. But Alex is gone. The Young Cop looks up as the Crow departs through the window and two other cops arrive. One of them Dutton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was that? (then seeing mess) Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dutton walks to the mess on the floor, curious. He squats Picks up a tag marked "Murder Weapon AC-005" staples ripp out, nothing attached to it. Takes in the crime scene pho of Lauren. Off the PIX...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA DRIFTS down through dark trees FINDING Alex at a grave beneath a sheltering tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I'd be with you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's kneeling in front of a HEADSTONE. "Lauren Randall 1982-2000. Always With Us."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Crow perched nearby. Camera circles Alex who looks up as the headstone WIPES through frame and... ALEX'S INTERNAL POV LAUREN NATHAN, a compelling sixteen year old, circles making an oddly sexy version of the "Oo Bruce Lee sound. A goof, a game she's playing with Alex, who circles opposite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ("Chinese" pseudo dub) Your Shaolin style is no match for my kung fu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Alex wipes by... RESUME Camera continues to circle Alex at the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not dead. And I'm not alive. And I'm remembering. And it hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX'S INTERNAL POV More goof kung fu, the circle closing Lauren laughing more, searching for words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your... flying crane style is no match for my... drunken tiger kick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RESUME Resolve strengthening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't be alive. Not without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX'S INTERNAL POV Lauren's starting to crack up, trying to think of what comes next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your... mad monkey... love ... is no match for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other a long moment. As they kiss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be with you forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX'S INTERNAL POV Lauren in his arms as the kiss ends, and she answers a question we never heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only forever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RESUME OVER THE CROW. Camera stops circling. Alex looks u at the headstone, silent tears in his eyes as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SINGLE BLOOD RED TEAR rolls down the cheek of the angel atop the headstone. Alex stops it with his finter. WIDER, the supplicant at the grave. And the Crow nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GIRL'S HAND clutches a HEART SHAPED LOCKET. TILT UP, it's Erin, wearing an identical LOCKET around he neck. School uniform, pleated skirt and school books. The splish splash of the wipers the only sound until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan looks over. Sees she's holding the Locket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to take this to Lauren. She'd want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey. I just can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay in the car. I'll only take a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin. I know you think she's been talking to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that. Really. It's just... now that he's gone, I think it's time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off her dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Benz stops on the roadway beneath Lauren's grave. The door opens... ERIN gets out in the pouring rain pulling her jacket HOOD up over her head. Locket in hand she runs to... LAUREN'S GRAVE The tree a shelter from the downpour.  Eri approaching the headstone when Alex emerges from behind the trunk. Drenched. She YELPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ok. I'm not going to hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't come near me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds his hands up, compliant. She doesn't bolt. But she's ultra-cautious. Like with a snarling dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a friend of your sister's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know her friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That locket you're holding. You have one just like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lifts the Locket around her neck. Visible to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, no kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father gave them to both of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's right over there by the way. (then) What did you do to your face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone else did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a friend of the guy who killed her, aren't you? You almost sound like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't kill her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know everything about your sister. I'll prove it to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud now) Stay away from me! Dad! Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OS, the car door opens. Then SLAMS shut. Nathan approache

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She whips around, points at... Alex is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you yelling about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy said he was a friend of Lauren's. He had like paint all over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean? He was right here. He was!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head, confused, then, looking around spots THE HEADSTONE. The track from the RED TEAR indelible even in the downpour. Off Erin, as she touches the angel's stained cheek. And her dad, soggy in the rain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A street LIGHT flickers on. Maybe because night has falle or maybe its just a rainy day. Thomas Leonard hikes up his collar, trying to stay dry, a he pauses a clutch of hookers huddled in a doorway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Tommy. Red light special. (hikes her skirt) Even you can afford it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head--don't need that grief--continues on t the next building and CAMERA FINDS... ALEX watching, holding "The List." He crosses off the nam for Eyewitness "Thomas Leonard."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy clears the stairs, heads for his door. Unlocking th second lock, he looks around, alert, like he heard something. Then opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex waits for Tommy, crouched by an OPEN WINDOW that loo out onto an alley, a four story drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sees Alex, then) March?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sssshhh. She's resting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the fuck did you come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big bang, primordial ooze, divine hand of a benevolent creator?  All possibilities. Although recent events have given me doubts about the benevolent creator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy starts toward Alex, who pulls the KNIFE from the Evidence Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lied at my trial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know you, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Capital case nine nine dash C one one five. Alex Corvis. (flashes knife) Exhibit A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM. Alex pins what looks like Tommy's arm. It's just hi jacket, but it immobilizes Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I said what I saw. Two kids arguing. A guy and a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you saw me with this. I never held it until today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your damage, man? Corvis hacked up that girl like a motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex HEAVES Tommy crashing into the window, smashing the glass and cheap aluminum frame. Tommy hanging halfway in, halfway out. Four floors above the alley. Alex rips Tommy's shirt where the knife alread cut it. JACKS the sleeve down. No scar there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One chance to tell the truth, Tommy. Who is the man with the scar? He planted this in my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no scar. Corvis made it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong. Answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOMMY'S WIFE enters from the bedroom, SCREAMING. Heavy eye makeup, looking like she just woke up. OS, a TODDLER CRIES as she throws herself on Alex and they spil back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him go! Let him go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey. Take the baby. Get out of here now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she doesn't leave. She pleads in wrenching SOBS that seem to affect Alex. The Crow lands in the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's all I got. Tommy and the baby. Don't take him. The baby needs a father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her MASCARA runs down her cheeks, a facsimile of Alex's mask. They share a long look, connected by pain. The Crow cawing a warning, hopping in the window as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your baby is crying. Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy nods at his wife, who heads off to the bedroom. The Crow gives Alex an admonishing CAW, then takes flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did they give you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They showed me pictures, what he did to her. Evidence. Said all I had to do was stand up there and not my head "yes."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (repeats, insistent) What did they give you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A job. Construction. Twelve an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy's wife returns, holding a fifteen month old BOY. Alex unfolds "The List," passes it to Tommy, blank side up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Write down their names. All of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Tommy takes a look at "The List" and flips it over... "THE LIST" Tommy points to the Police Witness list. Dutto Erlich, Larkin, Toomey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You already got 'em. Right here. These cops said the needed an eyewitness, or Corvis would walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX drops his head. All clear now. He laughes gently at the sound of SIRENS approaching, still blocks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA CREEPS toward the by now familiar Mystery Man, ben over his work at the table across the room. CLOSE. A lineup of short (2") rods. One selected with a pair of surgical forceps, INSERTED through a hole in human flesh, raising a considerable welt. Some bleeding. As the man reaches for a cotton ball, he notices an empty STAND among the taxidermy specimens. Marked "Corvus brachyrhynchos." He scans the table, searching, then throws up his hands, shielding his face as a Crow flies out of the darkness, right at him. The man turns toward Camera but we never see his face as the Crow wheels mid-air, flying past him a second time. A the Crow flies up and out a SMALL WINDOW, the man stands, hands on the desk. SLOW PUSH on the man, on... A ZIGZAG PATTERN of raised welts on the underside of his forearm, in high relief under the Draftsman's lamp. The "Scar." A drop of blood zigzags, running downward. SLOW FADE OUT. OVER BLACK, the CRACKLE of a Police Radio. We're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH ANGLE. A police CRUISER has stopped a late model CADILLAC SEVILLE on a deserted street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE POLICE CAR CLOSE. COP I.D. "Dutton, Philip" with a picture of the same face CAMERA FINDS working a bad comb- over in the rearview mirror. IN THE SEVILLE TRACY, almost sixteen, dressed for nightli sees Dutton primping in her rearview mirror. He's getting out now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She jostles her friend JANNIE, passed out in the front passenger seat, trying to rouse her. No luck. DUTTON moti and Tracy buzzes down the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hope not. License and registration please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy tries hard to keep her smile going as she looks through her purse. Not finding anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with your friend there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's... sick. (off Dutton) Actually she never had Mai Tais before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you, you've had them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not tonight. Honest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy paws through her purse some more. Vamping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you had a license, I bet I'd have seen it by now. How old are you? Fifteen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'll tell you the truth. Jannie drove us and was supposed to drive us back, she has a license, but I mean... look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dutton leaves that dangling. Circles around to the passen side...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whisper to Jannie) Get up, get up...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dutton opens Jannie's door, leans in, slides a hand betwe her slightly parted legs. Dutton smiles at Tracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CROWVISION High overhead. Tracy steps out of the car. Dut shuts the passenger door, points. Tracy moves behind the Seville. RESUME Dutton closes in. She's getting very nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to walk a straight line?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you... to bend over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, can I just call a cab?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy bends over the car trunk. Dutton eases her feet apa with the tip of his boot then pulls out his NIGHTSTICK, uses it to lift her tiny skirt slowly up over her butt. A he does, she stands back up, shakes her head "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'll ask your friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy's frantic, about to call out as Dutton moves to the passenger door, opens it and... OVER DUTTON - ALEX sits in the passenger seat now. Jannie shunted inward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mimicking Dutton) I want you... to bend over. Officer Dutton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dutton pulls his 9MM BARETTA on Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you come from? Out of the car. Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With insolent slowness, Alex finishes writing... "THE LIST" a red line drawn through Dutton's name. ALEX gets out of the car. Dutton SLAMS the door and Janie stirs, coming to. At least a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands on the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Question. These hands?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex advances on Dutton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dead, ditch weed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE. Dutton's finger squeezes the trigger. BAM! The shot blows Alex back at the Seville passenger window. Slumped face against the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omigod, omigod...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jannie's head pops up inside the car. She SCREAMS at... JANNIE'S POV Alex right in her face, nice and dead. Dutto lowers his gun BG. Tracy in a panic. Suddenly, Alex opens his eyes, smiles. Face distorted against the glass. She screams again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX wheels around, wrenches Dutton's wrist, vise gripped Dutton's gun falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies. Drive carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy rushes to the driver side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might want to call 911. Report an officer down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy SCREECHES off leaving Dutton in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a fucking hollow point!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it's true. Guns don't kill people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex draws the KNIFE--the murder weapon--from his costume

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think maybe knives do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep that thing away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not just some "thing." It's A C zero zero five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the skel broke into the evidence room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH. The knife moves and RIP! Alex yanks the sleeve off Dutton's uniform, revealing a SCARLESS FOREARM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A scar. On the arm. Of the man who planted this in Alex Corvis's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no scar, you freak. The Corvis kid made it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex glitches, hearing this a second time, then RAMS Dutt into a wall with a great CLATTER of trash cans. Alex all over him, holding Dutton's head firmly in his tw hands, like he could crush it in an instant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was innocent. You framed him. You. And Erlich. And Larkin. And Toomey. What do you think, Officer Dutton? An eye for an eye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex's thumbs inch toward Dutton's eyes, grazing Dutton's eyelids now and a wild thing happens. FLASH!  ALEX'S INTERNAL POV Dutton's Nightstick lifts Lauren's skirt. Then flashs of a bloodsoaked struggle, Lauren's death. An the surprise BAM! of a shot fired. RESUME Alex thrown by this. Relaxes his grip on Dutton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were there. All four of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dutton kicks him off, smashes a garbage can over Alex's back then pulls a SMALL SEMI-AUTO from an ankle holster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed her. I saw it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitch killed herself when she shot a cop in the leg. If she' just acted like a girl nothing would have happened. (then) So you're right, spooky. Happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! Alex barely slowed by the shot, advancing, Dutton starting to panic. BAM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex keeps coming, right up to the gun. Pointed right at his face, then... WHOOSH. Alex flips it around, RAMS the gun in Dutton's mouth. He couldn't talk if he wanted to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! We HEAR the blast as we... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM BAM continues, but these are TOY GUNS, fired in synch with POUNDING MUSIC. In the hands of TWO STRIPPERS. Topless, leather G's and chokers, black stockings, POLICE HATS on their heads, law enforcement stars for earrings. The CAPACITY CROWD responds as they pout, wield their weapons. AT THE ENTRANCE - MADDEN a straightfaced plainclothes detective, more upscale than the clientele, flashes a BAD at a BOUNCER who scowls, lets him pass. WITH MADDEN circumnavigating the mainstage, where the cop strippers are waving handcuffs now. At the edge of the room, LAP-DANCERS pull one-on-one's for twenties. Madden exits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACKSTAGE Madden moves past girls in various stages of undress. Smoking, yapping, waiting to go onstage. One loo up, interested, but he doesn't look back, exits into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN INTERNET PORN FACILITY Where "live" sex workers man tiny fantasy sets--a Dungeon, a Shower, a desk and blackboard meant to suggest a Schoolroom. Crudely built, but good enough for 500x800 pixel resolution. Madden stop a second, looking... OVER A MONITOR - THE DUNGEON SET UPDATES every six second the slowly changing low-rez version of the action on the set--a woman tied to a chair with bright surgical tubing. The picture refreshes and BG, the woman sneaks an expertl timed sip of Diet Coke, puts the can away before the pict updates again. A COUNTER shows 132,768 hits and climbing. Madden gives a look, like people are really fucked up, continues past a curtain with a "No Admittance" sign into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BACK HALL dark, the furthest recesses of the building. Madden continues cautiously toward... A DOOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is cracked open. Madden moving very quietly now, scowling as he peers through the slight opening. Three guys and whirring machines counting stacks of money Guns on the tabletops, in holsters, out of reach. The door flies open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of panic as the guys bent over the machines free Raise their hands, slowly turn. Then lower their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fuck. Don't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Erlich, Larkin and Toomey. Three cops we met at the execution. Erlich's cane nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the month end?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes. Never been better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Dutton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably parked near some high school with a hardon. Fuck never showed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone at all curious why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erlich, Larkin and Toomey exchange a look. Madden goes to one of the money counters and grabs... A STACK OF TWENTIES tossed violently at the ceiling. Larkin and Toomey scramble as the bills flutter down like leaves, picking them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You leave the door open with two hundred strangers out there!  What's it take for you guys to learn a goddamn lesson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one saw anything, Mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why Dutton's not here? Rigor mortis! He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Three exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One shot to the head, then fifty three stab wounds with a six inch blade. Any deja vu here? Think Corvus knife, missing from the evidence room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since last night. As usual, you're right on top of things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was supposed to end when Corvis died. Remember? The kid no one would miss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at me, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I didn't kill anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off. I mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Erlich and Larkin settle down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crime scene's a goddamn clusterfuck. Every reporter in town's trying to get a look at Dutton's body. I suggest we get a line on this before someone else does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who'd give a shit about Corvis at this point? Kid didn't have a friend in the world even when he was alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can think of one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erlich and Madden share a look. On the same wavelength. Erlich picks up his weapon off the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large CRIME SCENE marked off by tape, Dutton's cruiser where he left it. Several other cruisers nearby, lights flashing. An ambulance, stretcher being unloaded now. AN ACTION NEWSTEAM the one we've seen before, Barbara Gonzalez frontman, speaking into a mic, too far away for us to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a TV. Gonzalez audible now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... rumors multiply as officials refuse to confirm or deny reports of multiple, multiple stab wounds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonzalez CONTINUES UNDER as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad! Come in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND of footsteps racing down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop who found the knife in Corvis's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randall riveted by the TV now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're moving him now, body covered. It would appear that thirty seven year old Phillip Dutton is dead in the line of duty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE TV the Newsteam and Gonzalez SHOVED back by COPS running defense for the stretcher. Gonzalez grabs for the sheet covering the body and... NEWSCAM TIGHT on Dutton, as the sheet pulls down, partial uncovering... DUTTON'S HEAD: Comb-over hanging to the side. Blood dripp from crude letters carved in his bald pate--the word "DAISY."  Quickly covered by a COP who yells at Gonzalez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of here! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but through a digital miracle the "Daisy" frame has been grabbed, and appears as a still now behind Gonzalez. RESUME - FAVORING ERIN struck dumb by this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shocking even for these mean streets, the word "Daisy" apparently cut into his head by the perpetrator, still at large. A name. Perhaps a message...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonzalez FADES UNDER as Erin backs away from the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lauren called me that when we were little. Daisy. No one knew but us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey. It's doesn't mean anything. It's not a message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy in the cemetery today said he knew everything about Lauren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It still doesn't mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he'd prove it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Randall, as he sits on the bed, thoughtful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE. The ambulance drives off, lights flashing, and we BOOM UP over the crime scene, over the Newsteam, revealin the top of Dutton's cruiser, marked with a BLOODRED CROW. Continuing upward, FINDING... The Crow, perched high on a building. It takes flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Crow soaring through this lousy part of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Crow swoops in, lands on the roof of a low end brick building, peers down over the edge. Camera DRIFTS DOWN the side of he building finding a ligh someone burning the midnight oil. FINDING a CHESS SET mid-game near the open window as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAM! Erlich's CANE knocks a pile of papers to the floor off a desk piled high with briefs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know about any knife. I'm trying to forget that case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well someone isn't. They killed Dutton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit. You couldn't get close to him. But I'm betting you know who did. Who's into Corvis? Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erlich flips through a Rolodex, knocks it to the floor, then picks up a PHONE LOG off the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a lot of calls. Business slow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses the phone log out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH ANGLE. Watching the phone log fluttering down. INCLUDE ALEX, sitting where the Crow was perched, wearing Dutton's badge on his evolving costume. Alex winces at the voices faint but audible from below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the only one gave a flying fuck about him when he was alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lauren Randall did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Bitches are crazy. Richer they are, crazier they get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "THE LIST" The name "Erlich, Vincent" crossed off now by Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erlich limps through frame toward Walsh, grabs him roughl by the collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if you hadn't fried an innocent kid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about the real killer. You think of that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erlich violently tosses Walsh crashing back toward the window, falling by the chess board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're covering for someone, that's jail time. I got my eye on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erlich exits, slamming the door behind him. Walsh starts to get up, stops. Looking at his own eye level... ALEX'S CHESS BOARD set up identically to the game in Alex cell, a piece of FOLDED PAPER protruding from under the board. Walsh pulls it out. It says "Q-->B5" WALSH makes the move, Queen to Bishop Five. Smiles. Looks at... THE PAPER UNFOLDED says "Check." Walsh sets it down in th Chess Box next to... THE PICTURE OF ALEX AND LAUREN arms around each other in the woods, smiling. WALSH sensing something, a presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walsh moves cautiously to the curtains, draws them back. Nothing. He leans out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CROWVISION: Starting on Walsh, popping his head out the window two stories down, INCLUDING Erlich as he exits the building, gets in a SILVER PORSCHE. Picture bending wildly as the Porsche takes off and the Crow takes flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RED TRAFFIC LIGHT. The Porsche pulling to a stop. IN THE PORSCHE Erlich looks down, presses a button on the stereo. Elvis from his baroque period "If I can Dream." Erlich looks up, waves his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERLICH'S POV - THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD A BUM starts to "clean" the windshield with an OILY rag, leaving opaque smears on the once clean glass. THUD. A handful of gravelly MUD lands on the windshield, starts to get smeared around. ERLICH pounding the window from inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bum is giving the driver side window the same treatme Hard to see anything now. Erlich throws up his hands in disgust, reaches for the door handle just as... SMASH!  The driver side window SHATTERS as something ente at high speed KICKING Erlich across the car... Erlich's head bounces off the passenger window, leaving a BLOODY SMEAR. Alex in the driver seat now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Germans really know how to make a car, don't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOW ANGLE ON THE PORSCHE wheels spinning as it peels out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINDSHIELD WASHERS and WIPERS clear away the grime Alex smeared on the windshield, revealing that we're rocketing through a bad part of town. MUSIC CONTINUES as Alex pulls the KNIFE out of his costum with his LEFT HAND. It looks huge in the cramped sports car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Lauren knife) I heard you were looking for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the guy killed Dutton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to think of me as the guy who killed you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erlich pulls a .380 SEMI-AUTO stashed between the two sea Points it at Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex FLOORS it and... BAM. Erlich blows a hole through Alex's LEFT ARM, a yawning aperture through which Erlich watches the passing scenery a few improbably seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WOUND closes. Knife still in Alex's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. Me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your leg there Officer? Hunting accident?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOP. In one swift move Alex impales the knife THROUGH ERLICH'S WRIST, into his thigh. Erlich SCREAMS, tries to remove the knife, but Alex keeps a firm grip on the handl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lauren Randall shot you trying to get free. The fifty three stab wounds she died of came from you. Am I right? Ballpark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erlich tries to stay steely, yells louder as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corvette bumps over a sidewalk, runs a red light. A POLICE CRUISER going the other way pulls a stunt U, fli on its lights. In hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bumpier now as Alex's driving gets more and more erratic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Saudi Arabia they cut off the hands of petty thieves. What price for a life? Two lives?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH. Alex yanks the Knife out and FLASH, slices through the left arm of Erlich's jacket, sawing into the FLESH. Erlich's arm bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not my arm! What you fucking want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want Lauren. I want my life back. I want... to know why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Why's anything happen? It's all money, man. Money. The girl just got in the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex grimaces, then RIP, he yanks the sleeves off Erlich' arm. Erlich looks down, surprised to see his arm intact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scar. Which of you has it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex poises the knife for another descent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear. It's a bullshit fucking story the loser boyfriend made up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gives Alex pause. He shakes his head, clearing the reality glitch, looks up... IN THE REARVIEW MIRROR Cop cars, lights flashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corvette slides around a corner, screams into a final straightaway that dead ends into the sloping concrete sid of an overpass. The cops not far behind. The Porsche bottoming out on a bump now ant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex's sun visor falls partway down from the jolt. He reaches to push it back into position and notices... ON THE BACK OF THE VISOR The CAR REGISTRATION. Alex takes it out of the holder. RESUME Alex suddenly calm. He reach down for... THE CIGARETTE LIGHTER pushed in. The volume on the Elvis song pumped up. ALEX relaxes back in his seat as they scr toward the abutment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you out of your fucking mind? We're going to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you die if you're already dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're him. Corvis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was talking about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex smiles as the CIGARETTE LIGHTER pops out. He grabs i and the GLOW vanishes as he closes his fist around it. Erlich turns front in horror. The microsecond of terror realized as Elvis climaxes, the retaining wall zoomes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dream... comes true... right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! The Corvette hits at a million mph. Crumpling, disintegrating, and hurling two bodies bouncing off the abutment. THE CAVALRY - CRUISERS AND PLAINWRAPS Too late. A half dozen cars bearing down all lights and sirens. Screeching to a halt by what used to be a silver Porsche.  The ruptu gas tank spurting GASOLINE. A CRUISER screeches to a halt. Both doors fly open. Toome and Larkin step out. Toomey on his radio as Larkin looks up the embankment, catches a glimpse of... ALEX battered but alive, jerkily unclenches his fist, sti holding the Lighter, glow fading.  He tosses... THE CIGARETTE LIGHTER arcs down onto the ex-Corvette. WID BOOM!  Cops shield themselves as the Crash scene explodes in a huge FIREBALL that engulfs a cruiser stopped too clo by. IN THE TOO-CLOSE COP CAR the DRIVER rams the car into REVERSE. Tires squeal as the fireball hits and... THE TOO-CLOSE CRUISER Engine compartment ignites, a secon fireball racing backward into another Cruiser. BOOM! Total chaos now. LARKIN focussed on Alex, seen vaguely through the flames. Moving toward him. WITH LARKIN as he arrives at the top of the enbankment, draws his weapon. Hyperalert. Alex is gone, but he finds. ERLICH'S BODY two hundred broken boned bagged by bruises. Larkin pulls something out of Erlich's shattered fist. It's... "THE LIST" Dutton and Erlich crossed off. Larkin and Toom yet to go, but the first letters of their names are all contained in a VERTICAL OVAL, "DELT" circled in red. LARKIN, AS TOOMEY JOINS HIM They give each other an oh- shit look. Then Larkin checkes his fingertips, smeared re from... "THE LIST" - FLIP SIDE the CROW CIPHER, rendered thick in coagulating blood. Illuminated by the flickering light of the fire below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE. A heart shaped Locket swung gently back and forth, then closed in Erin's hand as CAW! Erin turns, sees the Crow perched on the window ledge. As she moves to the open window, the Crow flies off. ERIN'S POV - OUT THE WINDOW - THE CRASH SCENE far away, the flashing lights and sirens of fire trucks arriving to bring the fire under control. ERIN looks, wondering, then spots something closer to hom She moves off, WIPING through frame REVEALING... ON THE FRONT LAWY Alex. He looks down now, at the front door where...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin exits the front door and we see her framed against the huge house, a rich-man's castle built in the twenties of quarried stone, quarter sawn oak and leaded glass. Erin, like her sister, a child of privilege. She approach Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy. How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, I knew your sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed that cop Dutton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And another one. There. Erlich. Took a wrong turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex points at the distant crash site, the vague flashing lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are. (no response) That's why you paint your face. To hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not hiding. I'm right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed Lauren! You killed her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin shakes her head, trying to absorb what's going on, then RUSHES ALEX, screaming, beating on him, fists of fur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me. Dirty cops killed her. Dutton, Erlich...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex tries to handle her flailing arms but she's too mani He's getting hit in the face, the chest, and it's hurting He grabs her roughly, gets her to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been shot, and stabbed and thrown from a car and none of it hurt. But what you're doing now, does. I don't know why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad was right! He said you'd ruin her life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Listen to me. Lauren found out something they didn't want her to know. (then) This.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up a Card, the Registration from the Corvette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the bonfire over there. Look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Why are you haunting me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you need to understand. And you need... to be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to give it to her one more time, then flips the card through the air. She turns, watching its flight all the way to the landing by the front door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Your father wasn't right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns back and... He's gone. Erin walks to the door. Despite herself reache for the Card on the landing. It's... THE CORVETTE REGISTRATION which we see clearly for the first time. Owned by a company called DELT. The address i 4201 Forestview Drive. ERIN spins around horrified, holds up the Registration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE ADDRESS ON THE REGISTRATION - 4201 FORESTVIEW matches the numbers two feet away from her--the address plaque on her own house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buzz of nervous COP WALLA settles out as a stocky SERGEANT #2, clueless but honest, raises his voice, tryin to command attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen up! Yo! We got a cop killer out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walla responds "no shit"--and CAMERA BOOMS UP, moving to the back of the room over a nervous sea of blue uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Til we get an I.D. treat everyone like a suspect. Patrol assignments are posted by the door. Read them. No singles, it's the buddy system til we catch this asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant #2 CONTINUES UNDER as CAMERA FINDS... FAVORING LARKIN, TOOMEY AND MADDEN huddling together at the back. Urgent whispers. Larkin and Toomey try to conta their panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows. I saw him. Fucking zombie mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larkin takes out "The List" from the crash site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose name's fucking next? Not yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't testify. You're not on the list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flips it over) Scary guy. Not only survives that crash, but takes time out for art.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pockets "The List." Then looks up as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madden! Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire room looking back at the three renegades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old man's requested the pleasure of your company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madden shakes his head like this is bad news, rises and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECRETARY mans a LOW COUNTER guarding a large door at the end of the huge empty hall. She's got a heavy mascara trailer park vibe, looks up from her eyelash curler at th sound of approaching FOOTSTEPS. HER POV - THROUGH THE EYELASH CURLER Madden approaches. Stops. THE SECRETARY smiles, hits a BUTTON under the counter. The door to the Captain's office swings open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad I'm not you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right back at ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She checks out Madden as he moves past her, then puts the eyelash curler away in a NAILIT containing a couple of razor sharp SCALPELS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sunlight in this cavernous, wood-panelled office. The Captain obscure in skifts of shadow at the edge of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madden sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we had an understanding. I thought we understood that discretion is paramount.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madden does. The Captain begins and intense slow burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erlich gimping around in his goddamn hot rod is not discreet. I've got reporters asking me how much he made. I've got the entire force looking at this case now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the guy leaves a sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madden produces "The List," flips it over to show the Cro doodle in blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit he leaves a sign. He's a goddamn Picasso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain slaps down a crime scene photo--the Crow emblazoned huge on the top of Dutton's cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else do you know? Do you know this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain SLAMS a file down in front of Madden, who let things cool out a moment before looking at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads cover) Tommy Leonard. The eyewitness in the Corvis case.
