dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some hooker phoned it in. There was a riot at his apartment yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy dressed for Halloween?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you. You do know something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look up as the Secretary enters, holding the door open, like it's time to leave. Madden starts to speak and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say. Just do. Before it all comes tumbling down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Secretary gives Madden a look as he exits, then joins the captain who's standing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BY AN AWARDS CASE holding glass bowls and trophies presen to the Captain over the years for Civic Service. The Secretary wraps her arms around him from behind as he looks at his loot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Idiots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sssshhhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the only one who makes it go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he turns toward her embrace, CAMERA ADJUSTS to point u something we may have noticed... IN THE CASE - A STUFFED BIRD, on one of the glass shelves

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA CREEPS toward the large stone house. A light comes on at one end of the lower floor, shining through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin works at her father's desk under the light of an antique floor lamp. Using a LETTER OPENER to PRY open... A DESK DRAWER full of files. She flips through, finds a manila file marked--DELT. Takes it out. ERIN lays the fil open on the desktop. EMPTY. She checks... A SMALL PAPER SHREDDER under the desk. Judging from the paper spaghetti in the basket underneath, recently used. ERIN scoops up the shreds of paper. No way to reassemble this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to be casual) What are you doing there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin's a terrible liar, spooked as he approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I dropped an earring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you have them both on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She jumps up as her father reaches the desk, keeps her distance. He spots the empty DELT folder, closes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex Corvis didn't kill Lauren. Cops did. Didn't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not what you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away from me! Stay away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin. It wasn't supposed to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin SCREAMS, runs out the door with her hands over her ears. He misses a beat, then RUNS after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan catches up with her as she frantically grabs CAR KEYS out of a dish by the front door. He grabs hold of her arm, she struggles, CLAWS at his fac to get loose. Squeaks out the door onto...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin runs to the far side of the big Benz, parked in the driveway. Tries the door. The ALARM goes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They killed her because she found out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About them. You've got to leave it alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACROSS THE STREET, A PORCH LIGHT comes on. Erin hits a button on the key ring, CHIRP CHIRP. It stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetheart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call me that! Don't call me anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NEIGHBOR opens the door, peers at them from across the street. Inquisitive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would never hurt you or Lauren. Never. Believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Come inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm never going back in that house again. Get away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He edges away from the car, reluctantly. She starts to ge in, anger giving way to extreme sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying now) They killed Alex for something you did, daddy. You killed both of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets in the car. Starts it. ERRRKKKK! She peels out backward down the driveway. SLAMS the car into Drive and tears off down the street. The Neighbor shakes her head at Nathan, goes back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! Thomas Leonard bounces off the wall, drops to the floor. A FEMALE FIGURE wipes through frame, throws herself on Larkin, who's roughing up Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please! Leave him alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larkin backhands her sprawling to the floor, where she crawls to the WAILING BABY, takes him in sheltering arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not making this up. He had a crow with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caw, caw, that's what you're telling me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said I lied at his trial. It's Alex Corvis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we're talking... a ghost. With a pet bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn down that fucking baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby's gets quieter as the mom rocks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up, Tommy. I want to show you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larkin helps Tommy to his feet. Places "The List" on the table. Then RAMS Tommy's face down on top of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see that? My name's next on his list. It's fucking next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larkin hauls Tommy back upright. Dazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who is the guy, Tommy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corvis. It's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Take your time. Think before you speak. Cause at this point I got to hear something besides the crap you're been spewing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KA-CHUNK. Toomey cycles his 9mm. Everything dead silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said the whole trial was a setup. That I caused an innocent kid to die. Is that true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larkin grimaces. The only question is how to end this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madden stands by a plainwrap ,calmly SMOKING. A SCREAM above. He looks up to see CRASH! Tommy's BODY breaks through a window four floors up and falls with broken glass, landing by Madden who rubs his temple a second, then calmly grinds out the butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy's wife horrified, pleading, as Toomey raises his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice stops mid-sentence as BAM. The baby still crying as Toomey takes aim again, then low his weapon, starts to leave the room with Larkin. At the door, Toomey turns and BAM! The crying stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE. A diminished field of Chess Pieces. ADJUST to incl Walsh, scrutinizing the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks out the window a second. Then scans the room aga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. I'm talking to my myself here. It's humiliating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walsh goes back to the board, makes a move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check and mate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dream on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walsh looks up. Nothing. Then Alex steps from the shadows Walsh looks at him a long moment, sees through the makeup

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God. It's really you under there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two guys look at each other a long moment, cross the few steps to hug. Walsh blown away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to say you're looking good, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walsh leans in, examines Dutton's BADGE on Alex's costume

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two down. Two to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Down?" Wait, don't tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops from my trial. They killed Lauren. The whole thing was fixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Walsh) You think I'm crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking... that explains a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walsh sits down. Disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lauren's father's involved. He bought the cops fancy cars, I don't know what else. It's a company called D-E-L-T. I think Lauren found out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do they do that they had to kill her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hoping you'd find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I sure will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both turn as the Crow lands in the window, CAWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the bird) Boo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Crow flies off. Walsh goes to the window and looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the deal with this bird. It's been hanging around. Alex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns toward Alex, who's gone. A double take as Walsh gets it, whips around, looks out the window again. CUT TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far above a solitary car winding through an old-growth forest, its headlights stabbing the darkness. The Crow soars into frame, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A simple WOODEN CROSS illuminated by the headlights of th Big Benz as it pulls off the road into the grove of huge trees dripping with moss. IN THE BENZ Erin blank as she turns off the car, leaving the headlights on. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WITH ERIN as she steps from the car, walks toward the cro Partway there... CAW! Erin looks up, finds the Crow fluttering in to perch high overhead. Alex emerges from behind a tree, near the cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where it happened. Right over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stays where she is. Alex quiet, affected by the place Erin's about to lose it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Lauren was missing the police came to our house. They said they were looking for her, right? (breaking down) But I know now they had her, and the reason they brought her here and knew the could blame it on you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... is that I sent them here. I told them she came here sometimes. With her dirtball boyfriend. That's exactly what I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's crying softly. He draws nearer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin. It's not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (losing it now) It's all my fault. Oh God. I wish I were dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do, I really do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeming to lose patience, Alex lunges at her, like an attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were four of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's holding his hands over her eyes, transferring IMAGES that shake them both. ALEX/ERIN'S INTERNAL POV Jolting FLASHES. A Plainwrap stops where the Mercedes is now. A hand slams the car into Park. Doors open. Four men get out, seen dimly, but they're Dutton, Erlich, Larkin, Toom Erlich reaches back in to drag Lauren out of the back sea her hands cuffed in front of her. Dutton flips up her skirt with his nightstick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four large men. And still...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lauren stumbles into Erlich, grabs and BAM! FLASH! He takes a shot in the leg from his own, still holstered weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabbed one of their guns. Got off a shot, then ran, ran for her life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RESUME - PRESENT Erin's covering her face, like trying to avoid seeing some horrible thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex grabs Erin, forces her to run with him, awkwardly, like a three legged race. Tracing the path Lauren covered

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ran. Them breathing down her neck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin stumbling as Alex pushes, cajoles her, the two of them running toward a large tree, MATCHING to... ALEX/ERIN'S INTERNAL POV Lauren stumbling, her cuffed han hindering, tree limbs hitting her face. Her own panting subsumed in the panting of the cops on he heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... all the way from the road to this tree...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RESUME - PRESENT Erin still trying not to see. Alex forci her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This tree. Here's where it happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to see!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex spins her up against the tree and we MATCH to... ALEX/ERIN'S INTERNAL POV Lauren an adrenaline crazed figh destined to lose. Her movements UNDERCRANKED, strobed. Discontinuous and jarring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turned and faced them and went down kicking and punching and fighting them, fighting death as they stabbed her and stabbed her. Fifty three times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brutal cops overwhelm Lauren. She drops to the ground as... RESUME Erin drops to the forest floor, convulsed in sobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fought for her life because life is worth living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex panting. Fierce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about that. And then tell me how much you wish you were dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Erin, sobbing, heartbroken. Alex's fury waning as he looks at her, wonders if he did the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armed men and barbed wire. The Spotlight FLARES and we're

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An odd foursome approaches from the far end of the hall. Mercer escorts Madden, the Captain, and the Secretary who hangs on her bosses arm, gawking like a tourist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why wasn't the incident reported?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing to report. All inmates were present and accounted for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you pretended nothing happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Corvis fried. I don't really see how it could be him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I wouldn't expect you to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all enter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercer goes to the locker where he left Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be forewarned. Nature takes its toll. (opens locker) Bon appetit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The all look inside. The locker is empty. Mercer's the only one shocked. He noisily opens and shuts the other lockers looking for Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lost him! Now lay off the fucking doors!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercer stops, backs off, gives the power trio some space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They botched the execution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ. It was Corvis. Tommy Leonard was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you were a little harsh on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch now as the Secretary moves, drawn to the mirro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Babe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's looking at... T HE FRACTURED MIRROR. Shards of glass selectively removed forming, we see now, a CROW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking crow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sign of the dead come back to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madden turns, not comfortable with the concept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about sign of a big black bird?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dead can return, given sufficient motivation. And Corvis has that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy David Jenkins came back as a ghost because my uncle owed him four dollars. Followed him everywhere. Ruined his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time out. You really saying he's back from beyond?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Secretary nestles into the Captain, who whispers in her ear. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause if you're losing your mind, I got a right to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's looking for something. Won't stop until he finds it. (then) Sometimes the best way to get rid of someone is to let them have what they want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... with the scar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE. Erin sits cross-legged in the HEADLIGHTS of the Ben Alex perches Crow-like on the hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... took everything I ever cared about. Left me with nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're going to kill him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have to find him first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes his eyes. Pained at a memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what Lauren and I were fighting about that night? She had a secret, wouldn't tell me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I knew, she was pulling away. It made me crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to be so proud of him. My big deal daddy. And now, he's just a crook. Worse even. And the weird thing is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fights back tears. Gains strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could hate him but I can't. He said he'd never hurt either of us, and I know it's true and... I'm going back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what Lauren would do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin nods, takes the Locket off her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to forget. Forget what I know. Forget myself. Forget everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She winds up to toss the Locket away and Alex hops down off the hood. Stops her. Takes the Locket. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Locket) Keep it. Because it connects you to Lauren. And it connects you to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fastens the Locket back around her neck. A covenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter what happens I'll make sure everyone knows. That you're innocent. That you loved her. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE. Erin pulls some makeup out of her jacket pocket. Dumps it on the ground. Finds a pot of dark eyeshadow amo the containers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be me anymore. Make me like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin's face blasted WHITE by HEADLIGHTS. She closes her eyes as Alex begins the first bold lines around her eyes and for a moment in the gauzy white light she could be... LAUREN opens her eyes a second, smiles, shuts them again. WIDER. Alex paints Erin's face in the Benz headlights, th two of them kneeling in the forest-cathedral. Camera creeps BACKWARD, leaving the two of them connected by ritual. And touch. And a promise to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE. A mess of documents. Nathan nervously writing, assembling a tell-all at his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it doesn't work this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan gets up. Tries to subtly herd the Captain off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Partnerships don't end like that. Friendships don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our friendship ended when Lauren died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain circles to the desk now, past Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe in ghosts, Nathan? Because there's a ghost threatening us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean Lauren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain flips through some of the papers on the desk. Frowns. He closes a file folder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you never accepted that what happened to her was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An accident, Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding now) She was eighteen years old! There were four of them. They stabbed her fifty three times! Where's the fucking accident?! Huh?! Where is it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan furious. The Captain keeps a preternatural calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I watched her grow up. Just like you. I know how her mind worked. She kept snooping around because she was worried about you. What you'd gotten yourself into. So stop blaming me. And blame yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, quietly) I do. Every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin knows, doesn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This catches Nathan off guard. He starts to say something

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even bother. You never were a good liar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain flips through the papers on the desk again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this. Everything we worked for. You tell me... what are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEADLIGHTS approach from down the street. The Big Benz pulls into the empty driveway. Erin alone in the car, her mood tough to judge in the Cro mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin enters, steels herself. Then she calls out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?! You home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNDERWATER. Erin plunges her masked face into the wash basin in this white-tiled bathroom. ANGLE - ERIN A few SLO-MO DROPLETS cascade off her face into basin as she scrutinizes herself in the mirror, wipe off the mask. CAMERA INCHING forward... She listens up. Grabs a Towel to blot the water on her face. We begin to hear with her... DRIP. DRIP. DRIP... She tightens the sink faucets. The sound continues DRIP DRIP as she moves to... THE CLAWFOOT BATHTUB Faucet not dripping, but the sound i louder. DRIP DRIP. Erin grabs the shower curtain, whips i back REVEALING... NATHAN RANDALL behind the tub, face a mask of gore, blown off point blank by the BLOODY HANDGUN on the tile next to him. ERIN screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE. The Chess set. A few pieces moved off the board now. Alex not looking at it. He's looking at the picture of himself and Lauren taped in the lid of the Chess box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like a bowl of spaghetti. D-E- L-T is owned by Westwind Builders, Nathan Randall's company. But DELT in turn owns a dozen other corporations. A big mess to wade through, so I checked out Tommy Leonard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex picks up the BLACK KING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard, Dutton, Erlich. They don't matter. I want the King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're getting there. Because in his so-called construction job, Tommy makes a daily delivery to a place called "The Hole."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The strip joint?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe they call it a connoisseur's club. Owned by DELT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex places the picture of himself with Lauren back in th box of chess pieces, against the open lid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Places like that, they're about unreported cash, processing money from drugs, prostitution. (then) I took a chance, called asking for Larkin and Toomey, the two other cops. Whoever answered said "they're not here... (meaningfully) ... this is the front office."

dialogues.speaker: BAM BAM BAM.
dialogues.text: They look up. A shadow banging on the door. Leaving BLOOD SMEARS on the outside of the frosted glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walsh opens the door and Erin enters, wild and blood smeared, remnants of the Crow mask around her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They killed my dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It all catches up with her now, the flight, the exhaustio She throws herself into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ok, it's ok...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not. I can't take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin. Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I found him lying there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex immobilized by this. He turns to Walsh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it? This place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should get some support?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Call the police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this? Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex waiting for an address. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1315 Berkeley Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't leave me. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex turns to her, comforting. Holds her face in his hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be over soon. (then) Watch out for each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads off and we PRE-LAP sexbomb death metal POUNDING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More debauched than our previous visit. Darker, more crowded. Patrons propositioned in front of our eyes by girls barel eighteen. The room writhing. ON THE MAINSTAGE the "Cop" strippers we saw before, but dangerous seeming, as they pantomime an interrogation, a handcuffed "perp" manhandled between them. AT THE ENTRANCE Alex blows past people waiting to get in, creating enough disturbance that TWO BOUNCERS greet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toomey and Larkin. They're expecting me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Two Bouncers give each other a look. One points to a SIGN on the wall: "You must be 21..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to see some I.D., pal. Circus in town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Other Bouncer grabs Alex as he pushes past. Alex heav him into the line of WAITING PATRONS. As they go down like dominoes... the First Bouncer pulls GUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you want to do that. Lot of innocent people here... (looks around) A lot of people, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Alex starts off... BAM! He's blown back by a shot half lost in the noisy club. No panic yet. ONSTAGE the strippers break character, looking. The audie turns as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEAR THE ENTRANCE The First Bouncer goes flying above the heads of the crowd, getting off a dramatic SHOT while airborne, inducing... PANDEMONIUM Patrons stampeding as BAM BAM!  Alex taking bullets, the miracle lost in the chaotic exit. The Bounce out of sight underfoot. ON ALEX visible again, back on his feet. Buffeted, stationary as everyone flees. With the exodus still at flood stage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON WALSH, in motion as he puts on a jacket, throws some papers into a briefcase. He's nervous, ill-suited for thi cloak and dagger stuff, chattering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be safe in my car. Nobody will recognize it. Let's move yours in back, no, down the block. Hope it's nothing fancy. There's a chop shop around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's looking elsewhere, at the door that has quietly opened. The Captain stands there. Somber reptile. Holding a sheaf of papers in one hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You followed me here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Erin, I put out a bulletin on your car because... there's bad news. And I thought you should hear it from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him expressionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father got involved with some bad cops. On my force, so I take responsibility. (beat, then) He killed himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She talks with great difficulty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did he kill himself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a gun. Is that what you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I mean... how did he kill himself How do you figure he killed himself--with a gun, right--when it wasn't anywhere near where you found him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a step toward her. She pulls out the Blood Pisto Seems crazy enough to use it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin. Don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back the fuck off! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain stops, gently tosses the sheaf of papers towa her, onto Walsh's desk. The papers Nathan was preparing. Walsh looks at them while...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He left this. Names, addresses, a note to you. These people he was involved with killed Lauren. He couldn't bear it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God. He's right, it's all here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The note. Show it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin has one eye on the papers now, recognizes her dad's hand. The Captain inches forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Captain) Not you! (to Walsh) Show it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain steps forward, right to the desk. Erin backed into a corner now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's right there, under that paper. (grabs a note) Here. Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds a hand out for the note, taking her eye off the situation for one second as she reads...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE NOTE A bunch of numbers added together in her father' hand. Not a suicide note. THE CAPTAIN grabs Erin's wrist and BAM! A chunk of the ceiling falls as the weapon discharges. Th Captain throws her in a chokehold, her finger still on th trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were always the stupid one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fights as the Captain wraps his own hand over hers, wrestles her arm toward Walsh, in the sights now. BAM! WALSH blown backward, collapsing by the Chess Board. Tryi to pull himself up. Erin struggling. As... MADDEN enters from the hall, in a hurry, gun drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods toward Walsh, who is moving, barely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry. We don't have much time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM. A shot from Madden drops Walsh for god. As Madden drags Walsh toward the door, the Captain grabs... THE PICTURE OF ALEX AND LAUREN pulled off the lid of the Chess box, one of the pieces of tape left behind. The Captain exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC STILL POUNDS, lights swirl. But the club has cleare out, leaving human detritus, a handful of casualties from the stampede. WITH ALEX as he steps over the Two Bouncers, expired on the floor. A soft WHIMPERING marks the silence.  The girl cuffed onstage. Alex goes up to the terrified girl. Close up, she looks way underage. He gathers her clothes, spots a key on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She listens as he unlocks the cuffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have one chance to value your life. Take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches as she hightails it out the front door, still half naked. As she leaves... THE CROW appears in the doorway near the broken bodies. Alex takes a deep breath, as if it hurts. The casualties. CAW. The Crow flies on, disappearing into the back rooms. Alex turns, follows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex moves past the empty makeup table. A lipstick cigare smolders in an ashtray. People left in a hurry. MUSIC LOU as if inside our heads now. Alex continues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody home. Empty images refreshed every six seconds. Number of hits static now. Alex drawn now by the "No Admittance" Curtain which he approaches slowly, touching it and FLASH! ALEX'S INTERNAL POV - LAUREN looking over her shoulder, pulling back the "No Admittance" Curtain, going where she shouldn't go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lauren? You were here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lauren makes her stealthy way into....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: revealed as Alex slips past the Curtain, retracing Lauren footsteps. CAMERA FOLLOWS Alex CREEPING down the hall to. ALEX'S INTERNAL POV - LAUREN down the hall, peering insid the partially open Back Room door, then turning back startled TOWARD CAMERA as if suddenly overtaken. AT THE DOOR Alex turns back, like Lauren, looks behind him. The hallway is empty. He enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness. As Alex gropes for a lightswitch, a LIGHTER FLARES. Toomey and Larkin lean in, light up in synch. Alex takes in the dark fringes, dim reflections off lots of eyes. Not taxidermy specimens. BAM BAM BAM BAM. A dozen police officers lining the walls empty cartridges into Alex in an angry, STROBING fusillade. In the silence that follows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after the fact) Don't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang LAUGHS. Larkin makes his way to a light switch b the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drinks are on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larkin flips on the low-watt BARE BULBS hanging down past industrial pipes and conduit, casting a dim light on the cinderblock space. NO ALEX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look up and... BAM! Alex DROPS LARKIN with a shot to the forehead. BAM! He MISSES TOOMEY as bullets from below EXPLODE all around him. Alex scampers across framing as... The BARE BULBS burst, all but one, plunging us back in to near darkness as Alex drops to the ground near Larkin's fallen body. Jacks up the sleeve. No scar. Alex spots Toomey, rolls out as... THREE COPS pump rounds into Alex. BAM! Alex takes the middle Cop out, a TOONEY-LIKE GUY who fall onto Toomey, behind him. ALEX turns, forced to defend himself as FULL AUTO FIRE breaks open, the other flank, more advancing cops. While... TOOMEY crawls out from under the fallen copy, then backs out the door on hands and knees while... A FINAL EXPLOSIVE FUSILLADE leaves only Alex standing. As the echoes dissolve... Alex Alex moves to where Toomey was, bends down to check the body... THE NAMEPLATE - "TOOMEY" But the pin isn't fastened properly. The badge askew. RESUME - ALEX rolls the body over, finds another nameplate underneath. "Hauser."  Heads off in sea of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toomey!

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Toomey is clearing the "No Admittance" curtain when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dripped something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toomey panics as he approaches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERNET FANTASY SETS Monitors still updating every six seconds. Toomey hears Alex coming, slips through the "Dungeon." BEHIND THE SHOWER FANTASY SET Toomey takes refuge out of sight, next to a GAS HOT WATER HEATER, quiet as a mouse. ALEX tears the "No Admittance" curtain completely off its rod, arriving at the fantasy sets just in time to see... THE DUNGEON MONITOR Toomey (frozen) scurrying through. Gone now as the monitor updates. Then Alex appears, following him through the set... WITH ALEX moving to the rear of the "dungeon," on Toomey' heels. WAM. Toomey hits him full force with A PIPE, sendi Alex sprawling backward, COLLAPSING the flimsy Shower set WAM. Toomey swings again, misses Alex, but connects with. THE GAS LINE to the water heater ripped out by the blow. HISS. The sound of gas, loud, as the line breaks. RESUME Alex straddles Toomey, just as Toomey manages to get his gun pointed in Alex's face. Hissing gas nearby. CLICK. Toomey cocks the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spark, gas... bad combination. And it's not this leak here, that's the least of your worries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAM! Alex swings Toomey's pipe HARD at a much bigger GAS LINE right behind the gas heater, leaving it badly cracke The hiss magnified 100% nos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to play a little game called "Who's got the Scar."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Scar? What fucking scar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (buzzer sound) AAAANK. That's not how we play the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex jacks Toomey's sleeve down. No Scar. Alex pissed as Toomey locks eyes with him. Really seeing him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're him! You're Corvis! We fried your ass. You're dead, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thing in a situation like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pick up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some light filters in as a door opens to the outside. A FIGURE enters, squats among the bodies. He leans in, clos larkin's eyes, and we see... It's Madden. Blood on his hands. He hears Alex's VOICE faintly, then Toomey cries out in pain. Madden moves toward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madden creeps down the hallway to the back room. VOICES growing louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking Zombie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no scar. I'm telling you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Madden moves toward the conversation, his face registe the slightest of smiles. MADDEN'S CREEPING POV MONITORS obliquely visible as he reaches the end of the hall by the Fantasy sets. The "Shower" monitor shows Alex and Toomey, visible through the trashed set, updated every six seconds. MADDEN SNIFFS gas. The HISS now audible along with Alex's voice. Madden smiles. Pulls out his 9mm. And BACKS UP, away from the Fantasy Sets toward the back room. Madden takes aim at... THE FIRST MONITOR The images is Alex threatening Toomey. Updating now--LOSING ALEX on the Monitor as he steps into frame in person, looks up and BAM! CROWVISION a speeding bullet passes narrowly by and... ANGLE - GROUND ZERO as the bullet hits the monitor in a shower of sparks, followed by... BOOM! A ROILING FIREBALL Seems to vaporize Alex before flying down the hallway right at CAMERA. Madden manages a couple steps in retreat before it blows him into the back room with a deafening roar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! Windows blow out in a gas fired inferno. A body flu out the rear door. BOOM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interior/exterior being less meaningful than seconds ago. Walls crumbled, roof blown off. BRIGHT FIRE consumes the frame, consumes the bodies of downed cops, consumes every last bit of oxygen and life. Distant SIRENS draw closer. A SLOW SCAN, someone's OBSTRUCTED POV of Hell. INCLUDE ALEX watching from under a collapsed cinderblock wall that offers some protection from the flames, if not the heat. He looks, intent now, spotting... THE ARM WITH THE ZIGZAG SCARIFICATION sticking out of the rubble, murky through the flames, growing clearer as came PUSHES, flames licking at it... ALEX tries to move toward the arm. Forced back by too- intense flame as another beam falls, the rubble shifts and... THE ARM WITH THE ZIGZAG SCARIFICATION skeletal now, baked down to bones. A dozen short metal rods on the ground und it. He picks a few up. THE CAPTAIN drawn now to... UNDER THE RUBBLE - WHERE ALEX WAS water dripping off the concrete, collecting in the place where Alex hid. But he' long gone. The Captain drops the rods. Satisfied it's ove

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex staggers along in bad shape. Up ahead... A GIRL in her twenties exits a building down a flight of stairs, waits at the bottom for her BOYFRIEND, who's lock the door. She sees Alex, gives him an empathetic look. Alex walks slowly closer. ALEX'S INTERNAL POV Lauren appearing to him, playing thei game. But the words are wrong, distorted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your witness list is no match for my kung fu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her Bruce Lee "Oooo" a siren call. RESUME Alex moving slo forward on the street, drawn toward the girl who watches with horrified fascination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm losing you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your zigzag love scar is no match for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lauren and Alex drawing very close now when... RESUME WAM A FIST clocks Alex in the face, dropping him hard onto th pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about "thank you."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't bleed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And delirious. Better steer clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guy wraps his arm protectively around the girl, walks her off. Running into a COP at the next intersection. The POINT at... ALEX takes off, ducking into an alley. Confused. CAMERA CREEPS BACKWARD as he gathers his thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RATTLE RATTLE. Alex's shadow visible through the frosted glass, jostling the locked door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMASH. His arm PUNCHES through the glass, turn the knob. Alex enters, arm bleeding badly. He yanks a large piece o glass from his flesh. Painful. Alex registers that the rules have changed. He finds a necktie of Walsh's, uses it to bind the wound, staunch th flow. He scans the room again looking for... Something. But everything seems ok. He passes... The Chess Box, the picture of Lauren and Alex gone. Just piece of TAPE left, sticking to the top of the open lid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVER THE CHESS BOARD - ALEX the missing pic lost on him, drawn to the chess board where Walsh collapsed. Something wrong with the game. He finds... THE BLACK KING Off the board. On top of a stack of news clippings lying on the floor. Alex picks it up, LEAVING a RING OF BLOOD under. CAMERA PUSHES on the clipping underneath, the headline "City Leaders Vow Crackdown in Wake of Randall Murder." PUSHING, finding among the City Leaders...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAPTAIN'S FACE circled in blood. Camera continues to PUSH on the grainy newsprint, through it, until all we se are halftone pixels and the picture loses meaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Police Station in sinister CROWVISION as we approach, swoop in and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex walks the long approach to the Captain's office, pas the empty Secretary's desk. KICKING the door open CRASH! into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain works alone at his desk under a standing lamp Looks up unconcerned as Alex enters, walks to the desk, and SLAPS down the ring-of-blood clipping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate that picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you something? A glass of water? A transfusion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they? Last chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or what? You'll bleed all over my carpet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know crime was actually down until you showed up, or stuck

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: around, or whatever the hell you're doing here. (then) What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for my friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I heard you were looking for some guy with a scar. How's that going? You find him? Yes? No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex tenses as the Captain starts toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are like the guest who would not leave, you know that?  And judging from your condition, maybe you've overstayed your welcome. That's not a criticism. Just an observation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex draws the knife from his clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you're going to use it. That's Lauren's knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enraged, Alex SWIPES the knife. The Captain grabs his arm right at the blood soaked necktie, squeezes hard. Alex writhes in pain. In each other's faces now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come in here al lfull of righteous indignation, but what have you got to be righteous about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE KNIFE starting to fall from Alex's hand as the Captai continues to clamp down on his wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many innocent people did you leave dead back there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sent them. I had no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. You're a killer, that's all you are. A clown with a bird and a rising death toll. You think the world did you wrong?! You did the world wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain snatches the knife, RAMS it into Alex's midri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Lauren had a fight. You couldn't let it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX'S INTERNAL POV Lauren in tears in Alex's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs for her. She pulls violently away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOMP. Another stab into Alex. There will be fifty three

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was one thing her dad rejected you. But when she did you lost it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  I see doubt oozing out your arm. Where do people go when they kill their girlfriends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH ALEX'S INTERNAL POV Alex back at the inferno, cower from flames. RESUME The Captain full of righteous conviction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screwed up kid stabs her fifty three times. Where would he end up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain bent over Alex, stabbing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHES move us backward along the path we've taken so far, a tour of hell on earth, the blast of infernal winds and the ever-present voice of the Captain, condemning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strippers writhe at "The Hole."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's who you are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Porsche explodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sick fuck! Look at it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex blasts Dutton. BAM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every loser name anyone ever called you was true!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex escapes the taser. Mercer drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you looking? Answer me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time SCREECHING to a halt, all the movement converging on a single, quiet image. One we've seen before... Alex in the chair. But his last words are different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loved Lauren. I never meant to hurt her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZAP. Electro-spasm as the switch is thrown. No scar, no meltdown, just violent fibrillations that moderate, final as we MATCH TO... RESUME - THE CAPTAIN'S OFFICE The Captain shaking Alex, holding something in front of Alex's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see it? Huh? Did you see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex's eye's gone dead, no longer seeing... THE PHOTO - LAUREN AND ALEX IN THE WOODS arms around each other. Familiar, but on second take, it's like the crime scene photos... Lauren's NECK is SLASHED, her body riddled with stab woun Alex has a big smile on his face, his arm around her, her head on his shoulder. 100% sociopath. RESUME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think you fucking saw it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain drops Alex lifeless and bloody to the floor. Only the sound of the Captain panting now, then... The sound of slow clapping. Madden walks into the room from behind perimeter curtains. CLAP CLAP CLAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right. Picture's worth a thousand words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madden kicks Alex lightly, nudging him. No life signes. The Captain rips the picture in two. Tosses it in the tra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't believe everything you see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doubt is a motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a hand with this sack of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEW ANGLE - THROUGH A WINDOW DARKLY Madden and the Captai grab Alex, one at each end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's cute. Was cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL, this is the Secretary's POV through the window. She's bent over someone's toes, painting them BLUE. WIDE. The Mystery Room revealed. Taxidermy specimens line the wall and the table. Erin stands in PROFILE in the middle of the room, strange silent, hands tied overhead by a rope that runs to the ceiling. The Secretary brushing polish on Erin's toes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the face, well, makeup can work for you or against you. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Secretary applies a last flourish of polish, then stands, kisses Erin gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All done. Very nice. (then) You're a good listener.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Secretary moves off REVEALING... ERIN'S FACE MOUTH SEWN shut in a rough zigzag stitch, lik the scar. Her eyes dart as... THE DOOR opens. The Captain and Madden carry Alex in. Mad sweeps the TAXIDERMY SPECIMENS back with his hand, cleari a space for Alex on the table. Among them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CROW on its Corvus Brachyrhynchos stand takes a small hop backward, this sign of life unnoticed as... RESUME WHUMP. Alex heaved onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So was he dead? Or alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Secretary puts her ear to Alex's lifeless lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen birds stuffed and mounted so lifelike you'd swear you saw them breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This reminds him... he looks at the Crow on the stand. Lifeless, stuffed. As it should be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we had a case of that here. (to Secretary) Get me my kit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two are majorly demented. Anyone ever tell you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Secretary steps off to grab thekit, leaving Alex's lifeless open eyes pointing toward Erin, reflected in his eyeballs first before... ANGLE - ERIN looking up at her own hands, bound above her as she eases them apart and... The HEART SHAPED LOCKET slips from between her palms and she closes them again in time to catch the chain, the loc swinging. ON THE TABLE X-CLOSE. The locket reflected in Alex's lifeless open eyes a second before... The Secretary returns, blocking the sightline. Lays out the Kit, nasty looking tools left over from the Inquisiti Then unbuttons Alex's tattered shirt, undressing him for the procedure. Stab wounds everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty three?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In all the excitement I kind of lost count. (then) I think I'll mount him with his head up his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large KNIFE, the Lauren murder weapon, angles in at the base of Alex'sneck where the Secretary's head was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CROW - OVERCRANKED moves on the table. Takes flight. THE TRIO turn toward the commotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE LOCKET - OVERCRANKED Snatched in midair by the Crow from Erin's praying hands. FLASH!  ALEX/CROW'S INTERNAL POV HIGH ANGLE CROWVISION. Dim memories from the woods. Anamorphic and dark. Two figures--Alex and Erin--kneeling. RESUME - THE LOCKET released from the Crow's beak, passing through the TRIO'S HANDS uncaught, bouncing off Alex onto the table, in fron of his open eyes. ALEX/CROW'S INTERNAL POV FLASH. AT GROUND LEVEL. Alex fastens the LOCKET around her neck. The distortion lessening, becoming Alex's POV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... it connects you to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter what happens... you're innocent... I promise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH. Alex painting her face. RESUME Alex BLINKS. The Captain reacts--oh shit--starts t bring the knife down, a hurried strike at Alex's chest. WAM! Alex grabs the Captain's arm in his hand, stopping the movement on a dime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All lies. Everything you ever showed me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MADDEN pulls a gun, points it at Erin. ALEX jumps up, fly INTO the gun as it goes off. CRASH! They tumble THROUGH THE WINDOW into the Captain's office while... THE CAPTAIN cuts down the rope holding Erin. She collapses... ON THE TABLE strewn with blades, secreting one between he hands, in the second before... THE CAPTAIN drags Erin off. The Secretary flails at the Crow with a metal ROD, while... IN THE CAPTAIN'S OFFICE Madden has the gun on Alex now. BAM! No effect. BAM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madden sweating it now, continuing to shoot with no effec as... THE MYSTERY ROOM The Secretary finally connects with the Crow, batting it against the wall, noticing this coincide with... Alex goes flying against the desk, winged himself. Madden c Onfused, not understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the bird! Kill it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madden wheels, points the gun through the busted-out pict window into... The SECRETARY dives for cover as bullets explode around her. The Crow dancing, sprayed with debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE. Floor lights sequence above the door, heading for underground parking. "5 - 4 - 3..." The Captain watches the lights. Erin is slumped face first against the side of the elevator oppos him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You brought him back. Good. He owes you. We'll stick together, you and I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON ERIN face pressed against the elevator wall, intent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen but not heard. They ought to make it a law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin winces, looks down... THE BLADE emerging from her sleeve as she tries to hold i with her two bound hands. DING. The elevator jerks to a stop. THE CAPTAIN grabs her off the floor and she RAMS the blad into his abdomen with the force of the entire body. Twist it. The elevator doors open. ERIN pulls out the blade, claws her way out the door, the Captain hanging on to her, finally getting free as she swipes at him again, drawing fresh blood. Running now, into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin stumbles between cars in the dark underground garage cutting the cord off her hands, leaving it behind as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind her, the Captain unsteady on his feet, a wounded animal. He pulls out a GLOCK 9MM and KA-CHUNK. Cycles it. Erin dives between cars, scrambling on hands and knees. Looks around. HER POV - SCANNING a small garage with a few police cruis by a SERVICE AREA and no people. A barred GATE over the exit. No way out. ERIN winces. Then stifles a cry as she cuts the stitches off her mouth with the knife. Drops the threads on the floor and moves off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex runs past the glass AWARDS CASE, takes a flying leap behind the desk, seeking cover as Madden empties a clip a him. The slide ratchets back. Madden SLAMS another clip in, advances on Alex, hidden behind the shredded desk as... THE SECRETARY clears stuffed birds off the table trying t expose the wounded crow cowering back against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here pretty bird. Here birdy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOP! She grabs it, the Crow flapping desperately as... IN THE CAPTAIN'S OFFICE Madden creeps up on the desk, pee over it. Nothing. Out of nowhere... WAM!  Alex rushes Madden, bulldozing him across the room with a pained cry of brute force toward... THE AWARDS CASE CRASH! Glass shatters as Alex hurls Madde who swivels around in time to get off a last shot BAM! That collapses Alex to the floor. IN THE MYSTERY ROOM The Crow squeezes out of the Secretar grasp, leaving her holding a couple feathers. AT THE AWARD'S CASE Alex hauls himself off the floor as the Crow joins him. Seeing... MADDEN'S HEAD has taken its place among glass bowls and trophies, half decapitated by the glass shelf it now rest on. Down the shelf from the stuffed bird. ALEX rushes through the blown out window into... Seeing for the first time that Erin is gone, the rope hanging from the ceiling, finding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sitting on the floor, painting her own toenails BLUE, leaning up against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd they go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex eases the Secretary to her feet with a hand around her neck, her back to the wall. She looks UP, smiling at. WALSH - RIGHT ARM MISSING hangs high overhead from some kind of hook. His arm has been crudely removed. Underneath him, on the table, a BOX of 2" surgical stainl steel rods sits by a pool of blood. ALEX yells, reeling, as... The door flies open. A half dozen cops in, all targeting Alex as... THE SECRETARY plunges the Lauren KNIFE in Alex's back. He spins violently THROWING her HARD against the wall. WAM! Surprise!-she sticks. REVEAL, she's impaled on ANTELOPE ANTLERS, hanging off the wall. Her head drops, looking down as a stream of blood flows down her legs, drips off her toes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dying words) My nails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM BAM BAM. The new arrivals open fire. Alex reaches ove his shoulder, yanks out the knife with an odd slurping sound as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of GUNFIRE filters down from above as the Capta hunts his hidden prey. He stops, studies... ERIN'S POV - LOW ANGLE LOOKING UNDER A CAR The Captain's feet, joined by his hand as he picks up the thread she left on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: reproving herself as she turns toward camera. She looks back under the car, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain's feet have moved off. Where? She listens, hears nothing. Slips off... NEW ANGLE - ERIN takes refuge in the service area, crouch behind stacks of TIRES. Knife at the ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain's FOOTSTEPS audible. HER OBSTRUCTED POV between stacks of tires, the Captain, Glock at ready, PASSES BY, moving out of sight. Footsteps RECEDING. Then silent. ERIN Listening, neurons firing.  Cranes her neck to see. Nothing. WIDER the Captain appears BEHIND ERIN, over the stacks of tires. She's oblivious, then... Erin wheels, slashes across his wrist. The Glock falls, Erin grabs it, levels it at the Captain. Her finger tense on the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: gun) I know you too well. You won't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know me at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! She pulls the trigger, simultaneously wrenching the gun, aiming just enough off that... THE CAPTAIN yells in pain, rushes his hand to his ear, a bloody mess. He starts advancing again toward her and Eri pulls... THE TRIGGER again, again, again. No click, no blast. NOTHING. RESUME the Captain takes the gun from her. Shows her the CLIP he's carrying in his hand. Slams it into the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One in the chamber. That's all you get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin SCREAMS as he drags her off now and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CROW flies UP toward the small entry window. Alex follows, bullets exploding around him as he hauls himself up toward the windowledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERRRKKK. The SOUND of a car in a hurry audible as Alex hauls himself out the small window. Runs to the edge, spotting... FAR BELOW a dark sedan leaving in a rush, wrapping around the corner of the police station now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain nervous at the wheel. He looks over his shoulder... Erin's in the back seat, cuffed to the door handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sergeant and crew utterly speechless taking in the carnage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crossing himself) Holy mother of God. The devil himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up, where Alex vanished. Starts to climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex dashes over the articulated roof, trying to keep in sight... HIS MOVING POV partially obstructed, of the sedan below. Speeding around another corner now... ALEX alters course to cut the sedan off, jumping up onto PARAPET where he totters over the vertical face as the sedan turning onto the street below. THE SERGEANT AND CREW emerge on the roof. Acquire target Alex Corvis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop or...! Don't jump!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WITH ALEX as he takes a flying dive off the building, intercepting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dark Sedan careening up the street leaving the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAM! ERRRK! The Captain nearly jumps out of his skin, bar keeping control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin perks up in the back seat. Battered. Ever hopeful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE. As the speeding car passes under a streetlight, we see a HUMAN FIGURE standing on top of it, legs spread, arms upstretched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUNCH IN... CLOSE. The Figure, Alex, strikes downward, right THROUGH the glass moonroof. CRASH!  IN THE SEDAN the Captain horrified as Alex's hand yanks his own right off the wheel and up, through the moonroof... ON THE ROOF OF THE SEDAN Alex kneels now, holding the Captain's arm up as he jacks the sleeve down exposing... THE ZIGZAG PATTERN, THE MORTIFIED FLESH held in Alex's hand like the trophy it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex's voice appears. Calm. Unhurried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jolt, eight amps at two to three thousand volts. It lasts a few seconds. The current surges and is turned off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIND ALEX'S FACE in the darkness. Moving as he performs some unseen task. Intent, focussed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wait for the body to cool, then check to see if the heart is still beating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIND ERIN, in the darkness, listening to Alex's voice. She touches her mouth, little drops of dried blood where the wounds are already healing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it is... ba-boom, ba-boom... another jolt is applied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLOW FADE IN as our eyes adjust to the dim light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Experts say unconsciousness occcurs before pain has time to register. They agree electrocution does not "hurt," could not hurt. But it does. Unimaginably. Believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in the death chamber. Dark. Claustrophobic. The only light a few panel indicators and spill from the door open from the adjacent observation room to the outsi Alex looks at the phone on the wall. Silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't expect a call from the Governor. Any last words? Captain, my Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL the Captain in the chair. A private execution. Eri slumped along a side wall. Totally inscrutable. Intense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat of silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that it? Well, ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not dying for your goddamn illusions. You got that? You think you and your girlfriend had some rosy future ahead of you? Bullshit. She was already bored, why do you think she was looking around? You're nothing, Corvis! Less than nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Figure wipes through frame moving toward the switch. Th Captain's voice rising as he senses time running out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do this to me you little fucks!  I'll come back, just like you, a big fucking shit spewing bird and three guesses what little bitch I'm taking out first...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE. The switch thrown. ZZZZZTTT. PAN UP off the switch to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances at the Captain, fibrillating in the chair, starts to move off. Then stops, near Alex, looking with him at... THEIR POV - THE ZIGZAG SCAR fibrillating, as we PUSH into seething detail. Writhing bodies, human suffering, a hellish miasma that draws us in until we turn our heads away, released.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Erin exit the visitor's entrance, met by the Cro and the first rays of morning light. He puts his arm around her and she places her hand over his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to get some breakfast? (then) What I mean is... I don't know how this works, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, face to face now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the woods you said you had nothing. But you wouldn't, and I wouldn't if there's some way you don't have to go. Please. At least not right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin. I'll always be with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a split second, she's... LAUREN Smiling. Sublime. She kisses him. As the break off it's... ERIN AGAIN She hangs on a long moment before letting go. Then she spots something... ON THE GROUND - A SIGN carried by one of the protestors. "Remember the Victim." With a picture of Lauren. Someone has written a bold "s" after it. "Remember the Victims." ERIN picks up the sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex. Look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to Alex. But he's gone. She tries to keep it together as... CAMERA BOOMS up leaving her alone outside the prison wall with her memories, and her conscience, and her hopes, whi is alot. As a DUSTDEVIL whips up in the parking lot, she drops the sign, and starts to CRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that moment when Alex went... wherever he went... when he made that choice, I knew I was making a choice too. To be alive. In the world. And it made me cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA FINDS Walsh, laid out on the table now, missing ar mercifully away from us. The CROW alights nearby, somethi in its beak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the world is a bad place but the Captain gone has to be some improvement. And that hope, that tomorrow will be better, is enough to keep me going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Crow flaps off, REVEALING the WHITE KING, laid by Walsh's head. CAMERA keeps MOVING, FINDING.. The Crow, on the stand marked Corvis Brachyrhynchos, stuf and mute. Its eyes blink a last time, then are motionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: X-CLOSE. JOURNAL. A not-too-loopy feminine hand, writing the words we are hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I think of Lauren fighting and dying, it tears me apart, but it also reassures me. That Lauren and Alex were meant for each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL... Erin is writing the journal, but she's a radica transformed wild child. A shock of vividly colored dreadlocks, some of the holes that stitched her mouth shut kept permanently open by stu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That they're together now. Fighters. United by love. And anger. That they've given also to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's leaning up against a new headstone. "Alex Corvis 1981-1999 Always With Us."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love Alex. As my sister always hoped I would. And I love Lauren. And I know, because of this, that love does not die. I'm alive. Thinking of them. Hoping that, sometimes, they're thinking of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin stops writing, closes the journal, stands. She takes the Locket off her neck, drapes it over Alex's headstone, like the one already over Lauren's. She stares at the two a moment, then puts her index finge to her lips, transfers kisses to the two stones. And leav
